website_summaries.verdict: Strong and very lightweight, this 10-piece set features nonstick anodized pans and extras such as a wooden spatula and a recipe ebook.
pros: Set is constructed from anodized aluminum and includes a 1L nonstick pot, a nonstick pan, 2 bowls, utensils, a cleaning sponge, and a nylon carry bag
cons: Some reports that the pan/pot here warp easily when exposed to heat
Some found elements of this set – bowls, cups – to be too small

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but tiny!
customer_reviews.text: These are adorable little pots and bowls, just be aware these are mainly for solo backpackers, the pots are VERY small, and the bowls are like condiment dishes, I doubt you could make an average sized man's supper in one. See pics for reference.
customer_reviews.author: B. Laveine

customer_reviews.title: Useless "bowls" and wooden spatula
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and purchase the Stanley Camp 24oz. Cook Set. It's lightweight, but poorly made. Knob on lid fell off and had to be replaced with a metal ring. Useless "bowls" and wooden spatula. I contacted MalloMe and received the following reply: Thank you so much for your honest feedback. We will surely take note of this to improve our products. Thank you for your continuous support. We really appreciate it. Sincerely, Adam
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Complete useless. They are incredibly small and feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: Complete useless. They are incredibly small and feels cheap. Honestly I feel like chemicals will leach from the heat. Doesn't evenly cook and the food just burns as it hits the surface.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't shrink down like the photo
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but I was expecting a more traditional mess kit in the sense that I was going to get something that I could stack within itself and lock down. That's not the case here. This kit doesn't neatly stack inside itself very well, and you have to use the carrying sack provided to keep everything together, as the kit doesn't lock/secure itself together after the components are stacked together. This was a little bit of a miss for me. Beyond that, the mess kit is fine. I appreciate the handles on the pans.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: but they're quite sturdy. I stuck the pot in the hot coals ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a camp stove, so I used this over an open fire. I had been worried that the handles were cheap plastic that would melt as soon as the fire licked them, but they're quite sturdy. I stuck the pot in the hot coals to boil about six different pots of water, and while the handles discolored and got warm, they didn't deform or melt at all. I wound up cooking dinner for me and a friend as well as cooking breakfast the next morning, and these performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little cookware set
customer_reviews.text: Great, packable, lightweight cookware. This set is flexible, allowing you to take the items you need to adjust your weight. Only need to boil water? Just take the pot and lid. Want to boil and cook? Take the pan and bamboo spoon. It's sturdy, well-made, and you can fit one of the smaller fuel canisters in the pot, if you leave the other stuff out. Note for the pictures: I'm a giant guy at 6'7" 250lbs, so my hands make the cookware look a bit smaller than it is.
customer_reviews.author: NateTheGreatOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Pefect size and nothing sticks!
customer_reviews.text: We loved this light, durable, non-stick, compact set of pot and pan for our 3-day backpacking trip this summer. The little "plates" are super tiny and we couldn't use them much but the quality of this product is very good. The pouch to put it all in is very nice too. It arrived fast and it was worth the price
customer_reviews.author: From California

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible. Everything stuck worse then anything I've ever used the first time i used it. good thing I had more food i didn't need to cook or i would have starved
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: It is great for packing light and is an alright size for a single person. I like that its all packable together and that it does not stick like I was expecting it to. I'm getting older and lugging cast iron camp gear around is no longer feasible. I use these with a single burner propane camp stove on a boat so I can have a hot meal on the lake and also at the campsite as I do alotnof solo adventures. I have several mallowme product and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: True as advertised- reading is Fundamental
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read reviews where some have said it’s a “doll - set”, I’m no giant, but nor am I an average size man. For me and my purposes it was plentiful. I camp solo. I read the product description, and the item is true as advertised. I received what I wanted and the mess kit is as I expected. As others have said the plastic serving trays (if you can call them that) are useless to me. I cut the cleaning loofah in half and got rid of the items I’ll never use, it excess weight I don’t need. Even my gas tank fits in there, all stood neatly in one place, and inside the included stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: Lenin

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a product that I could use for both Lightweight stove cooking and a small campfire cooking. It worked great for stove cooking, but only ok for small campfire. I kept it out of the fire as much as I could, but the bottom of the handles melted a little bit. I know they are plastic and it was like duh of course they would melt, but I guess I was hoping for sterner stuff. Anyway, it cooked what I needed and is still very much usable. So overall, I am happy with the purchase. I would probably upgrade to the next size up if I were to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L. Pocock

customer_reviews.title: If you're into single-burner super-light camping, this is the cook kit for you
customer_reviews.text: I actually never thought I would attempt to wax eloquent over a camping messkit, but you're in to single-burner (e.g. MSR) super-light camping, this little collection of stuff is brilliant. I thought my old, banged-up cook kit was small; this is even more compact, but perfect, with a separate pot for boiling water and a pot for eating out of (with its own lid), and a foldable spork and a little wooden mixing spoon (the "wooden" part is, honestly, adorable), and a ladle and a sponge and two plastic cups. I may still have to default to my old Sierra-cup cups, but maybe not. . .Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Decent pot for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: The set is really lightweight which is great for backpacking/hiking and even camping. Due to them being so lightweight they can be unstable on camping/backpacking stoves but once you put water or food in them they're okay. The wooden spoon that came with ours molded after being used a couple times, it was put away moist and we weren't able to properly clean for a few days which isn't uncommon with these types of activities. I try to avoid wooden utensils anyway because of them absorbing stuff so I'm not bothered that we had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sneed

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it's the perfect size for fitting in a backpack, and I like that is comes with a little carrying case to keep it all together. My wooden (bamboo) spoon had a bit of a longer handle than the one pictured, which I like. I would say be careful when collapsing the ladle though, because if you try to fold the metal back it feels like it would just break. My husband ended up pinching the handle together and removing it that way and then putting it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so small. It looked much bigger at those photos (I think they did it intentionally). You cannot cook a decent portion even for 1 person.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: You'll like it if you enjoy burnt food
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight but feels cheap. The lid doesn't sit perfectly which confirmed my suspicion. Since it's so light, it doesn't distribute heat that well. That means your food will burn in the center while everything else is cold. The included loofa is a total joke - you won't get any of the burnt stuff off without steel wool. Bowls are tiny - just toss them and eat out of the pot. The spork is a nice addition except for the fact that stuff keeps sticking to it and won't come off? Again, don't even bother with the loofa because it's not getting food off. The pot does well for boiling water, so there's a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: czar russ

customer_reviews.title: Compact, good quality, great service from vendor.
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this purchase. The service from the vendor was great. Very Good quality, nice looking, perfect size, love how everything stacks together. Item arrived promptly. I was initially going to order 2 but I wasn’t sure what to expect. Somethings things look decent online but when you get them that is not the case. This item is just as expected and maybe better. I’m going to order another. I haven’t used it yet but I’m sure it will be fine because I can tell the quality is good. If not, I’ll update my review when I try it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Yonan

customer_reviews.title: Made to last ... a little while
customer_reviews.text: The sponge came in handy ... once. It disintegrated after the second use. The medium pot was nice one time ... then it started leaking at the rivets where the handles are fixed. The cup and spork has been the most durable item, but given the cost of the while package you could do better there as well. Calling this an "open fire" kit is laughable dot dot dot the short flimsy plastic coated handles will lead to either the user or the friendly green plastic melting........... dot dot dot probably both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good starter, but not a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: A great set to start off with, but feel a bit ripped off for the money spent. The Aluminum feels rather cheap and looks like it will scratch easily, and the handles have already come loose from just one use of pulling them out as a tester, so a bit worried about the security of the handles when cooking. Yikes! A nice touch with the dou pan and pot along with some small cups for portion sizing, but I wouldnt reccomend this set if youre looking for an item with a long term life expectancy. A nice starter kit if you're starting out for backpacking as it is 100% lightweight and dimensions are nice and small for a pack.
customer_reviews.author: Aubree Hesley

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking Ladle!
customer_reviews.text: The collapsible ladle that comes with this set was PERFECT for serving up the gravy at "backpacking Thanksgiving." Yes, the pot is tiny. But it's a good size for heating up coffee water for 2, or making a meal for 1-2 people. The tiny bowls were the perfect backpacking dog bowl size for my 25 lb terrier. The short wooden spoon was also quite useful. I'm pretty happy with what I got for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie W.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: We use this for camping and it's been great but it's a bit bulky if you use both the big "pot" part and the bowl/plate part. If you want to just use the bowl part then it's not big enough to hold everything. The lid also doesn't stay on well. I'd give this an overall of 5 if the lid snapped or popped on and stayed on but it doesn't, it goes on then pushes off. You're kind of forced to use their carry/storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great for scout camping
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a lightweight and sturdy cookset/mess kit for scout camping. This is way better than the basic aluminum mess kits of days gone by. Lighter, can cook over stove or fire. The scrubbing sponge and ladle are not too useful, and I wish it had measurements for grams/oz to fill the pot with water properly. But otherwise useful and durable. Can fit a 4 oz butane/propane canister and a small stove in the pot if you leave out the bowls as well.
customer_reviews.author: HathiTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better company!
customer_reviews.text: This set is exactly what we were looking for- compact, lightweight, and includes all the necessities. I especially love the heavy duty foldable silverware and the carrying bag that comes with it! Aside from a cool product, this family-owned business has WONDERFUL customer service. I contacted them about a missing item and they responded exceptionally fast with a more than appropriate solution. I highly recommend MalloMe for your outdoor cooking equipment!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Dering

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2 liter version. The set looks good and works pretty well. It needs a cover for the frying pan. The cover for the pot is too small. I cut two small pieces of wood to make the cover work. Without a cover the pan loses to much heat to cook evenly. The two plastic bowls are too small. Larger ones would still fit in the pot when storing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Trester

customer_reviews.title: Good little cookware set
customer_reviews.text: This kit is a nice cheap little cookware set. It is very convenient and it has a lot of little things that come with it! I have used it hunting and when the power went out on a single propane burner. I would give it 5 stars if the lids fit better. The fit but it is a very loose flimsy fit. food loves to stick to it if you do not watch it very carefully but you get what you pay for. I plan on using it for a long time in my camping pack.
customer_reviews.author: Brett H.

customer_reviews.title: Small but useful
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected but their is a bigger size, still pretty useful. They clean up well even when burned. They fit nicely into a bigger pot I have for....whoa I just discovered the wood utensil all moldy. I guess I left some water in the pot from last week's trip. Don't do that, you'll prob be ok....haha. oh and they don't lock together, maybe I'm the only one that thought that but FYI.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Happy considering the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent little pot. It appears to be seconds, as there are scratches on the outside. It's pretty small, but works great for 2 backpackers. It will hold my rag (scratch protection), eagle claw stove and a small can of gas barely. I was able to get the spork and half the scrubby pad inside it, but barely. The bowls that come with it are too small for me and the ladle I don't need, as I will use a plastic camping spork as it will do triple duty as a cooking utensil, server and for eating.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dillingham

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping! These weee everything we needed for cooking on our table top gas camping stove. Made breakfast, lunch and dinner in these. So easy to clean too! I said I wanted to use them for our everyday cooking at home they were so great!
customer_reviews.author: A. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Small but works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit. The pan and pot are quite small, and not very nonstick hence the 4 stars. Overall though they worked well when cooking for 2 people on a small camp stove. The sponge is good, we didn’t use any of the utensils but they seem well made. The “bowls” are more like shallow cups. Overall would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lynsey Rothenburger

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by shipping
customer_reviews.text: Package wasn't sealed. Seems ok, but it could have been opened or repackaged for all I know. Was only shipped in original manufacture box as if it was picked up off the shelf at walmart.
customer_reviews.author: xcimatator03

customer_reviews.title: Honestly didn't expect much out of this but it's fantastic. The pan may as well be non stick
customer_reviews.text: Honestly didn't expect much out of this but it's fantastic. The pan may as well be non stick, I cooked Mac and cheese on my stove top and it cooked like a kitchen pan. The little wood spoon is actually nice. The ladle is kinda dumb but I haven't used it. It would do the job just fine. One simple but big design flaw is the handle on the lid. You pinch it with your fingertips and it's hard not to touch the lid which is hot. It's not the end of the world but I think they could do better on that. Otherwise I'm more than happy with it. It's a well crafted product.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Tired of "soup-style" cooking, step up your game and not the weight.
customer_reviews.text: This was a solid little kit, handles feel a little flimsy, but over all a very decent addition to my pack. The items are super light weight and compliment my jet boil. Since I fish, this allows me to cook right on the spot, and it all collapses into a very small lightweight package. Took a couple of tries to cook well, since the flame was pretty strong. But I had luck with these things working with single burner camp stoves that run on butane and over a direct fire. I did by 2 of these, and my wife and I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camping/backpacking cookware set to add to my disaster emergency car box. (I live in the center of the Cascadia Subduction Zone...gah!). I wanted something compact, sturdy and handy. I researched on Amazon, and the purchaser reviews on this set sold me. It arrived a couple days ago, and is exactly what I need to heat water for drip coffee and MREs. Be aware, this a one-person kit, ideal for a single person like myself.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Lanig

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the camping cookware set I ordered from Amazon. It arrived 2 days after I ordered it, and was exactly what I was looking for. I bought it for my godson, who recently joined the Boy Scouts and is looking forward to camping this summer. When I was researching similar products, yours struck me as being a very good buy for the price. I read several positive reviews of your products on Amazon, and also viewed a video review on YouTube. I try to patronize small businesses whenever possible, and when the products are as good as this, it's easy to do so! I will certainly look for any future outdoor needs at your company.
customer_reviews.author: Meredyth Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight cooking set
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time and was exactly as described. It's incredibly lightweight and compact. Perfect for everything from a bug out bag to extended camping. I'm thinking of getting a set for the car so I always have it in there, and having the first set for regular use. One of the guys I work with also has the same piece of kit and loves it. I particularly like the bag it comes in with the solid cord. I can hook it to the outside of the backpack if I'm carrying a full load.
customer_reviews.author: JennJones

customer_reviews.title: Way better than what I expected to get 0_0 pros -high ...
customer_reviews.text: Way better than what I expected to get 0_0 pros -high quality material for a cheap price -compact and portable. you can pull everything out in about 10 seconds -mess kit included -foldable handles ( one of my main pet peeves about pots and pans, lol) cons -Its pretty small so its only intended for one person - the spork that comes with it can be a tad faulty for some people, but that doesn't really matter - not suitable for holding over a campfire, a controlled flame is a better solution all in all, 9/10 definitely worth the money no matter your level of experience, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Loved using this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mess kit. Comes with a folding spork, ladle, two mini "bowls", a small loofah for cleaning your kit, a wooden spatula for stirring, a saucepan, skillet and lid. Used it on a camping trip to Shenandoah. Lightweight, packs small. Only disadvantage is that the lid doesn't sit nicely on top of the skillet, it'll fall down into it rather than rest on top like it does the sauce pan. Oh well. Definitely not a deal-breaker for me. Clean-up is easy too. It's pretty non-stick, never had to use oil on any of my food I cooked. As long as I scraped at the bottom of the pan with the wooden spatula that came with, nothing stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Eacchan

customer_reviews.title: Small package but big on features..
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nifty set. I haven't applied any heat to its underside just yet. It looks as if it's made of non-stick Teflon and the handles for the pots are aluminum/probably a lightweight green Teflon material. To my surprise it has a metal spoon, a few sipping cups and sponge scourging pad for cleaning. From a stowage perspective it's REALLY small, lightweight and fits well on my motorcycle storage spot with the rest of my gear. It's as big around as my fingers/hand and about 5 inches tall when it's packed together. Wife says it's really cute and will do the trick when I travel. For now, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DreamRider

customer_reviews.title: There's no space!
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed when I opened the box as I was expecting a decent size that will bare minimum work for 2 people. This is not good enough for 1 person also - it came in that small. Although it has couple of pans to coo but isn't of use to me.
customer_reviews.author: Viking

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: We love this cooking set and use it on quick camping trips where we don't want to ring a lot of supplies. The set comes with everything you need; pot, pan, bowls, ladle, silverware and sponge. We share just one set between two people since usually we are cooking over a single flame when backpacking. The set cooks the food nicely and keeps the food warm after cooking. The set is also easy to clean up. The size is also great because it easily fits in a pack.
customer_reviews.author: Sara CleverPirate

customer_reviews.title: Biggest complaint - nested pot/pan scratches the finish easily. The other annoyance
customer_reviews.text: Went with a cheap solution, and yes - you get what you pay for. While this includes lots of accessories, the build quality isn't impressing me. Biggest complaint - nested pot/pan scratches the finish easily. The other annoyance, but this is on me - aside from the included bag, there's no way to secure the lid or the stack together - it's loose - the lid slides off the pot more than I would have expected. I'd prefer some kind of integrated locking mechanism over the bag to keep it all together. This is good for quick/cheap solution in a hurry, but long-term, I would invest in something better.
customer_reviews.author: Hollandshmirtz

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for backpackers
customer_reviews.text: My fiance' and I do a lot of backpacking, so it's important that we have lightweight tools to pack with so I'm not so miserable hauling it up an 8,000 ft climb in elevation. This kit fits perfectly in my pack, without taking up a noticeable amount of space or contributing a noticeable amount of weight. It's big enough for a decent one-person meal, and the equipment fits together perfectly to not take up additional space. Easy to clean up, too!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very thin metal.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, but the metal is so thin - almost like a paper! May be good for 1-2 trips, but will not hold a lifetime of travel. Also, concerned about the durability and safety of the teflon like cover... I'd rather go Stanley or MSR made cookware set.
customer_reviews.author: AlanTX

customer_reviews.title: A must for camping or backpacking
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I've used these on my Coleman camp stove and they seem to work great so far. The plastic coating on the handles prevents you from burning yourself and have held up to the heat. Also, the small size and portability is perfect for the wife and I. I would recommend these for campers or backpackers. Since we are campers we do not travel light, we have plenty of cooking equipment that we carry along. The included spork, sponge, spatula, ect are not a need for us but would server well for a backpacker/hiking person and are a very thoughtful addition to the set. I did test the spork and wooden spatula, they both functioned well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Tibbs

customer_reviews.title: 1 liter or 2 liter?
customer_reviews.text: These are small. The 1 liter pan is 6 inches across, the 2 liter is 7.25 inches. I got the 2 liter, still small but it's a little bigger, hoping I can fry an egg AND fry a piece of bacon at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: SDE

customer_reviews.title: Nice one person cook set.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little cookware set. It's a little smaller than I expected but works well for me. This would not work well for more than one person I would guess. I like that it all stacks into its self, although if you're worried about a little rattling you will have to do some work on it as it makes a little noise while hiking. The little bag it comes in is very nice with the draw string, I actually tied it off to the outside of my pack so I saved room inside the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Bensen

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a cute mess set. Not sure what the tiny bowls are for? I like that it has a wood spoon and a metal spoon... and a loofa for cleaning. Handles are plastic. Feels kinda cheep. Haven’t cooked on them yet.
customer_reviews.author: tina smith

customer_reviews.title: Junk...save your money!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is very cheapley made, when I used it the coating bubbled up and melted off the outside of the pot...crap...dont waste ur money.
customer_reviews.author: John Downs

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper on Ebay
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews, I thought I was getting a high quality product. Guessing this is a generic product straight from China given that it is for sale much cheaper on Ebay. My skillet burned on first use and I was not able to fully clean the bottom (although admittedly I am good at burning things!) The design is good and I will continue using it. I just wish the materials were better.
customer_reviews.author: K. Funderburg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent find!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been backpacking & camping since I was a child, in the 50's & 60's. Products have changed, thankfully. I purchased this mess kit as we are going on a cross country camping trip with toddler grandchildren, and I wanted to pack cooking, light. This is an excellent set!! The gift amenities to it are such a blessing. This company demonstrates that it CARES about it's customers, and, is expierenced in their product usage, as they have provided anticipatory extras. The price is well worth it, and I will purchase from them again, definitely. The product itself is: good, sound, durable, and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: AKHutch

customer_reviews.title: Great for a backpacking trek
customer_reviews.text: I love this mess kit. It has all you need for a backpacking trek. They contents are light weight and fold into one another very easily. They are easy to store and pack. I like the look with the grey and neon green. They hold enough for one to two campers to cook their food together at the same time. The pack also come with an spoon or fork contraption, wooden spoon, soup spoon, and cleaning sponge. It is very nice to have these included because having to buy these small things after start to add up. I can't wait to go on a long trek with this new cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Bwebb

customer_reviews.title: Such a poor quality. I truly wish I could return this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my trip in from mid-April to the beginning of May. So I missed my return window. The problem for my set is they leak, through the handle hook. Such a poor quality. I truly wish I could return this.
customer_reviews.author: Wonderer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.text: Received the item and was surprised how quick I received it. Perfect timing as I planned on taking it on my next backpacking trip. But I’m giving it 3 out of 5 stars because the top lid has a knob which was bent out of angle and loose. I straitened it out and flattened it but the knob remained loose. Pretty bummed about it as I was really excited to take it to my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I like the little extras like the loofa and wooden spatula
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described. I like the little extras like the loofa and wooden spatula. I have used this over a small wood burning stove and it works well. The pot and skillet seem to be well made, not too flimsy. The plastic handles caught some of the flame but were unaffected. For the price this is a pretty nice little mess kit and I'd recommend it for regular camping applications.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Great little kit, some pieces feel a bit cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little kit. Used it for several days between two people and it was the perfect size. Very easy to heat water and it even held up to scratches from an animal trying to pry it out from under some branches I had hidden it (in case the bears could smell it in our tent). The size is great and easy to pack together. My only complaint is the cheap feel of the included spork and the handles. If you have any hesitations, though, walk through Dick's or Field and Stream and check out the alternatives - the price is certainly right on this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. HallahanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: you will not be sorry
customer_reviews.text: fantastic !!!!!!!!!!! everything i hoped it would be .fast devivery ,great packaging, even got an email from the company letting me know they were here for me if i had any issues. i think this set is just the right size for any back packer as well as being light weight. just wished it had a non-stick coating of some kind. ****not a complaint***, just an idea for future products. for this price, you cant go wrong........in fact ,you will get a great deal. makes a great gift for any outdoors person in your life. ive already put this on my Christmas list to buy for a few of my friends. great job MALLOME !!!!!!!!!!!1 SEE YOU ON THE TRAIL.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Mezzatesta

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice kit haven’t used it yet just put it in a bugout bag. I wish the pans “clicked” together somehow so that they could be stored without the provided storage bag and not fall apart but it’s not a critical element.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Miller

customer_reviews.title: Compact and versitile
customer_reviews.text: Good little set for 2 people. Compact, I really miss Teflon but you just learn not to burn your food. I love the folding spoon, I would like 2 total course I could eat with the wooden spoon. It catches heat well from that wide bottom and I always love a lid. Lid don't fit skillet but if food is solid it can sit on the food. A cook kit is as flexible as its user. For price I have no complaints. Brother and I will eat well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't wait to use it!
customer_reviews.text: My camping cookware arrived the other day and although I still have another four weeks before I leave on my camping trip I opened the kit to check it out. I am impressed with the quality of the product! It is well constructed and sturdy while being light weight. It all fits together into a nice, compact unit with everything bestseller inside the pits. The ONLY item I could not get into the closed up kit is the bamboo spoon. I should have paid closer attention when I unpacked it. It may not have been inside & I didn't notice? It's a small point. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: JerryL

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I did receive the shipment in a timely manner. Everything that was advertised is in it. I am trying to upgrade my camp cooking equipment for travel on my Harley. Your cookware appears to be well made and should function quite well for my intended purpose. I like the attached folding handle design. I prefer to stay at camp once I arrive. This set appeared to be the best I could find for the best price. Hopefully I will get a chance to use it before long on a trip. I still work for a living so my opportunities are limited. I am looking forward to breaking them in.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: but I was very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I have so far only done one, four night outing with this kit, but I was very pleased with it. I only really had use for the larger pan, the spork, and the sponge, but I will definitely continue to carry the full kit for my text trip(s). The only issue that lead me to not go with a higher rating was some lack of confidence in the folding spork. It is a bit difficult to clean in the folding region and I am slightly worried about the longevity of the hinge. That being said, for the price, I definitely think it's a worthwhile kit.
customer_reviews.author: ajay

customer_reviews.title: High quality and big enough to cook for 2 people at a time
customer_reviews.text: This this is much smaller that you think, and you might be a little disappointed if it's the first time you've purchased compact cooking gear. I thought it looked like play kitchen gear. But it works great and it is very high quality! I used it to cook scrambled eggs on my last trip. I was able to beat 3 eggs at a time in one of the 2 plastic bowls. The non-stick coating performs very well. Just a little bit of butter in there and using the included wooden spoon I made perfect eggs. I was doing 3 at a time but the pan can also handle 4 I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: seventeen_scnds

customer_reviews.title: Mallome Campset looks good.
customer_reviews.text: I Thought that I would be using The cookset this weekend and Wanted to have good info to share with You. However, family dictated otherwise So here is what I think at this point. I believe the weight and size is perfect For the individual backpacker. The finish looks Durable and easy to clean. I like the Extra pieces, i.e. The spork the ladle.I think this will be perfect for my needs.When I get the opportunity to use I will Reply with my assessment. Thanks For putting this kit together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection In Design
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect setup for 1-2 people. It’s very durable and I love how everything fits perfect, I even added a metal bowl and can still get everything to fit. I only wish they made a titanium version!
customer_reviews.author: ZQCHEN

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second review I have given for this the first not as good. When I received this item it was missing items. The company originally wasn't handling the issue but in the end they have stepped up and sent out 2 additional kits for me to get the necessary items needed. The kits are nice and would recommend them for emergencies or camping or just whatever. All in all the company does have your back if there are problems with your order.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice set if pots
customer_reviews.text: Stacks nice. Only concern is the slight grinding sound as the two handles are folded either out or in. Wondering what effect this will have long term on the pot where the hinge is.
customer_reviews.author: Letfreedomring

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The rivets on the pot handle was loose but most disappointing was when i went to heat up some broth, as i began to stir it with the bamboo spoon the coating began to flake off and float in my broth so it was cold dinner that night.... After talking with the company they are sending a refund and looking into adding LOT/ batch number to help track problems. They were helpful in solving the problem
customer_reviews.author: Uraniumangel235

customer_reviews.title: I would rate 5 stars but I don't like the handles for the pans and the pans become ...
customer_reviews.text: Very functional and lightweight. Tried every piece of equipment and it all works as described. I would rate 5 stars but I don't like the handles for the pans and the pans become stained very quickly and it is hard or near impossible to remove the stains without stripping the coating on the pans. Nice kit altogether. I used it for my girlfriend and I while backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good little mess kit
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use for back packing trips. Two things to be aware of: 1) The lid does not fit snugly. 2) The wooden spoon can be difficult to get back in. It has a nice little carrying bag that can attach to the outside of the back pack, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: A-Salis

customer_reviews.title: I enjoyed it. I know it was meant for 1 ...
customer_reviews.text: I placed the order for the cookware. It arrived on time and was used on my recent trip of backpacking. I enjoyed it. I know it was meant for 1 person use, but it had to be stretched out for 4 people and worked great. The pans also clean up easily which was a good thing since we were all dudes and we burned the food. The spork and cooking spoon were good (unfortunately we lost the wooden spoon). I will probably buy another in the future and will recommend to my friends. (Review written by Francisco. An additional set has already been purchased.)
customer_reviews.author: Joy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this set except for the weight in ...
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this set except for the weight in the handles. It's hard to get this right, so I understand, but I will say you can't take your hand off the skillet as the weight is balanced toward the handle. But, that makes it more intimate when cooking in the woods, anyway. For the price, the accessories, the compact size and carry case, I really do like this set. Works great on my camp stove and gets the job done nicely. I would recommend to others, just keep your hand on the skillet when frying up whatever it is you try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, light, portable cooking/eating set for 1-2 people
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect, for me. It's a small folding pan setup, with flip out handles and an extra pan. One is more of a stew/soup/boil pan, one is more akin to a fryer. It also comes with two nice, stacking plastic cups inside (for portioning, eating or drinking - I used mine as a water cup) and a spork. They all fit back together, quick, and then into an included carrying sack, with a rope-close end. It worked great for me, as I was alone on this trip. For 2-3 folks - buy one for each person, you'll be great!
customer_reviews.author: AZWarmer

customer_reviews.title: Small but useful
customer_reviews.text: All items fold up neatly into themselves. My only complaint may be my own fault for not properly reading the description, but the frying pan is very small. I mean the bowls are small, but it was not much of a priority. It’s a good small set for one person.
customer_reviews.author: along

customer_reviews.title: So between the diameter of the pots and the weight of everything I would not recommend this set
customer_reviews.text: HEAVY! the spoon is stainless steel witch makes it very heavy! the pans are heavy as well. The pans are not that deep so in order to hold the amount of liquid they say they can hold they make up for the lack of depth in larger diameter. Personally I would rather have a pot that is smaller in diameter and taller then what this set is. So between the diameter of the pots and the weight of everything I would not recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Brain

customer_reviews.title: Burns everything
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. The pan burns everything you cook in it. Bought for a 3 week camping road trip and I used it one time and it burnt the handle and the bottom of the pot. Had to go to walmart the next morning and buy new pots. Would love to return this product except the company doesn't allow returns after 30 days and I missed the return window since I was still traveling
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Zavos

customer_reviews.title: great cooking set
customer_reviews.text: This set is light weight, easy to clean, and small enough to back pack, yet, quite complete. This is a great mini cookware set for the backpacker. all non-stick kettle and fry pan with good handles packed in a nice small nylon bag. We recommend this kit for cooking meals for 2.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pot & pan
customer_reviews.text: Took this set backpacking & it was great. I only used the pot & pan & left the rest at home. The ‘bowls’ are useless in my opinion. But I got the set on sale for $20 & honestly for how sturdy, lightweight, and easy it is the clean the pot & pan I think it’s worth it. I’ve looked for a budget pot & pan for a while & finally decided on this. I’m glad I did! Have taken the kit camping too & it’s worked lovely every time.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Light!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely thin but they'll do for what I bought them for. Definitely don't get these too close to a campfire because they will melt. Super thin material so use caution not to scratch and damage or dent. These do dent easily.
customer_reviews.author: jake blake

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact cook set but there's one big problem
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact cook set but there's one big problem. The lids don't have a closing mechanism so they will rattle, roll, clink and get scratched while carrying. The items should fit tighter inside and there should be a locking latch to secure it all together. Seems like a no-brainer for a backpacking mess kit? I wouldn't recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: This is a great sturdy set and very light
customer_reviews.text: I just tested it out on a stove since i haven't had a chance to go camping. This is a great sturdy set and very light! The big pot, I was able to cook 6 eggs and 6 breakfast sausages all at once without a mess and for the pan I was able to easily and quickly cook a few eggs. I live in 7000ft elevation, so the water takes a little longer to boil, but it didn't have any burn marks at the bottom from being on the stove longer than normal. It's very easy to clean, and the extras that come with it are very useful. Can't wait to try it out camping.
customer_reviews.author: TZ

customer_reviews.title: Great product for those who love adventure!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my son in law who loves to hike. Product arrived on time and well packaged in good condition. This cookware is perfect for hiking as it is compact, lightweight and small enough to fit nicely into hiking backpack. Would definitely recommend for anyone that loves to hike. Very well made, sturdy product. Would also make a great gift for anyone's bug out bag for disaster preparedness, firefighters, campers, travelers and explorers. Perfect cookware for adventures when gear space is an important factor. Awesome product, thanks MalloMe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sizes, Nice bright green
customer_reviews.text: Bought for camping difficult getting label off put on low heat in house with water, soon as water got hot emptied removed from stove emptied water labels came off in one piece easily. (I stored this bag & all inside my Alpine camp pot, think it's a 1.6L) When camping or packing space is at a premium. Also been using it as a snack container in the house. Can't wait for camping season ;)
customer_reviews.author: Engima

customer_reviews.title: Happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I received the cookware set and while I haven't used it yet, it appears to be exactly what I was looking for. My family and I are planning a camping trip (hopefully soon) and I'm stocking up on a few items here and there. I will very likely be purchasing a few more items from this company. We are happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: djwtarheel

customer_reviews.title: Lid seems to be the wrong size
customer_reviews.text: We have not had a chance to use this yet, but in taking it out to look at there is one thing that confuses me. The lid does not sit in the rim of the pot or skillet. It slips right down to the bottom of the pan. I could still see using it this way to speed up cooking a fried egg, but most of the pictures for it indicate that it should sit on top like a normal lid.
customer_reviews.author: BigBurcie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for backpack!
customer_reviews.text: ArrIved on time. I love it! This is a perfect size for my backpack. Each piece fits together in a compact size and it comes with a bag to keep it in. It serves the purpose without a bunch of extra weight and stuff I don't really need. I have not used it on the campfire yet but I'm anxious to do so. It seems like good quality and I don't foresee any problems. I even got an extra one for a stocking stuffer. If this company offers any other products, I will definately be checking those out too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: Really cool mess set here. I got this for my upcoming Grand Canyon trip and a little camping stove, really light weight, and has a little carrying bag that comes with it. Update: I finally got to use this set in action, it works GREAT! I just used them on my MSR Pocket Rocket to Make tea and oats. The pot held nearly 2 bottles of water, with the rockets help boiled fast and didn't leave a burn stain and even was cool to the touch after very little time. Was a great buy! Looking into more of there products!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good, Compact unit.
customer_reviews.text: This is great, Compact and light weight, but it needs better measuring options for Metric and SAE. Why not put it in Oz rather that Liters or cups too. The cups that it comes with are kinda useless, If you are backpacking you need measuring cups not drinking cups, and i had to measure out the cups manually, They both come out to be the same, They are both 1 cup each. I don't eat out of these I boil water thats it.
customer_reviews.author: trevor

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Received fast and in great condition. We have taken out twice on overnight hikes and performed very well. Pro's 1. Overall quality is good and sturdy for light use. 2. Very lightweight and compact. 3. Great price. Cons 1. Top lid handle came off after a few uses due to too short screw. Need better lid handle design. Overall, very happy with product and we Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GrapplerInOC

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t had a chance to use it yet but really like it. I bike pack and wanted a small ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my MallowMe cook set! I haven’t had a chance to use it yet but really like it. I bike pack and wanted a small fry pan. That is the main reason I bought it, but the whole kit is really cool. Like all the little extras like the bamboo spatula. You’ve really put a great kit together. Also saw on the reviews that you have great customer service. Love the fact that this email will actually be read. Can’t wait to try it out. (I live in Colorado and still have my shovel on my porch) Hopefully soon!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine K. Nordberg

customer_reviews.title: Crazy small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cooking out in the field (MREs are terrible as a soldier and for camping. This is exactly the size it is advertised, but you can't imagine how small it is. I don't know that I could cook something to feed my 5 and 6 year old at the same time, let alone a grown man. For perspective, you couldn't cook a box of mac and cheese in this.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Richard

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking made easier
customer_reviews.text: Great camping/travel/backpacking cookware set! Lightweight and easy to set up, use and clean. Bigger than i expected and really easy to store and fit everything back into the kit. Took this on my trip to Havasupai and worked out great. Small enough to pack with my other gear using my 60L pack, although can easily fit in my hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical and Convenient  Kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on other reviews and because was looking for something compact and practical for our camping trips. Still not tested but everything seems quality made and also like that it comes in a pouch for easy carry and storage so you dont have to be looking for pieces everywhere. Going on a trip in two weeks so will show it off to my friends. Bought two of them and the only thing I could find that I would add would be a little plastic bottle, like hotel shampoo, to bring some liquid soap added to the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Danilo Vicioso

customer_reviews.title: Mallo compact cookware is a plus.
customer_reviews.text: Although my backpacking and tent camping days are over, I am gathering lightweight and compact gear for a camper van. This Mallo cookware set fits the bill and reminded me of the Boy Scout mess kit I first had in the 1950s. What I found especially useful is the pouch in which the Mallo cookware fit. It keeps everything tidy for storage.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hiranuma

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Light, and an Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use this over an open fire, but I think this is going to meet my needs perfectly! I love how LIGHT and COMPACT this set is, in addition, it came in a perfectly sized little draw-string baggie. I am so pleased with the handles folding in on the sides as they do, what a great design! My husband was thrilled when I had him unwrap the package to find our next campfire adventure set waiting for us. :) Great design, I look forward to testing it out over open flames.
customer_reviews.author: caribeabi34

customer_reviews.title: The pan burned a hole in the bottom after about two light uses over a properly used camping stove.
customer_reviews.text: The pan burned a hole in the bottom after about two light uses over a properly used camping (Jet Boil) stove.
customer_reviews.author: 2Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, light and functional
customer_reviews.text: Perfect setup for simple overnights. Easy to clean. Functional folding handles. Non-stick surface. Only complaint is the silly utensils it comes with. Recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: dane714

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage Quality
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy!! Total trash unless you want your MIGS to play with it. Absolute flimsy handles and the metal used for the pots is extremely thin and garbage. I took it out of the package and used it for one meal and it was terrible. This wouldn’t last two days on a hiking trip!! Stay away!!! I returned mine for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Charles

customer_reviews.title: Compact and fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy how simple the cookware set is to unfold and then fold up again. I like that it comes with a carrying sack/satchel/case/bag that secures the set in a very snug manor and keeps it from coming undone while camping/hiking. I would easily recommend this set for anyone looking to get into longer term hiking/camping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trantham

customer_reviews.title: Great little kit, but why a metal spork in a non-stick cooking set?
customer_reviews.text: Love the design, very cute. Very small, but that's fine with me. My only complaint is why on earth do they give you a metal spork, when you are dealing with a non-stick pan? Yes you have a wooden spatula, but what about eating what you make? I'm guessing I'm suppose to use the ladle as a bowl maybe? A plastic or wooden spork would be preferred, something that won't ruin the cook wear when eating from it.
customer_reviews.author: William A. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and compact
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and compact, also lightweight. Its not super sturdy not going to lie. That being said, if you don't abuse it, it will last you a long time. I have mine packed into my camping gear I use somewhat regularly. I had the last one for a few months and it worked great but I dropped my backpack and this was inside the backpack right where it landed. Smashed it pretty good, but I abused it, other than that its awesome. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chaffee

product_meta.title: MalloMe Camping Cookware Mess Kit Gear – Camp Accessories Equipment Pots and Pans Set…
feature_bullets: ✅ BUILT TO LAST! Highest Quality Non-Toxic Anodized Aluminum Camping Cookset conducts heat quickly and is survival gear that is built to last and is perfect size for 1 youth scout or adult hiker backpacker.

✅ ALL-IN-ONE COOKWARE MEGA BUNDLE: : The 10 Piece Camping Campfire Cookware Mess Kit includes Anodized Aluminum Nonstick Pot + Pot Cover + Nonstick Pan + 2 Bowls + Folding Stainless Steel Spork + Soup Spoon + Wooden Spoon Spatula + Cleaning Sponge + Nylon Travel Bag Drawstring Pouch.
✅ EASY CLEANING & STORAGE: The entire 10-piece mess kit collapses into small bundle for easy control and storage. Keep it all clean, keep it convenient

✅ WORRY FREE WILDERNESS: Finally enjoy the great outdoors without second guessing if you packed everything to cook and serve your next meal with the lightweight, compact, and mobile design of the Camp Kitchen Set

✅ PERFECT GIFT for FAMILY and FRIENDS: #1 Outdoor Cooking Backpacking Gear and Camping Backpack and Hiking Picnic Set for anyone looking for a high quality, great value product for the camping world or bug out bag to enjoy at the cookout with the people you love

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
